Perceptor/Windlord:

"I remind you, Zarak, that you and Jiaxus are our gues=
t in the BlackFortess" said coldy Perceptor "and not the Master of the hous=
e, so remember where is your place; Darkhawk, take this... Patetic bot to t=
he interogation chamber, you and Zarak take every piece of information that=
 coudl be usefull, even if that means to use painful means; when you have a=
 good amount of information we can go to take the matrix... The rest, we ha=
ve to keep an eye in maximal base things are becoming interesting lately th=
ere, Rodimus... I need you for task"


Windlord started to drag Tuscon to I=
nterrogation quaters, under the block of cells of the blackfortres, deep in=
 the botton of the base


From: Sandy 
Sent: Monday, February 22, 2010 9:41=
 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortre=
ss


  
OOC: I am now playing Rat Trap as well as Tucson.

BIC: The best wa=
y to avoid a bad situation was to avoid it all together. That's what Rat Tr=
ap's philosophy was, until now. For some really remote reason, he had to go=
 into the dark tower. Perhaps it was for a scrap of energon that he sensed,=
 or something even more compelling than that. In beast form, he could fit a=
nywhere that had a small crack or crevace. There was none to speak of excep=
t for a vent hole which he decides is the only way in. He scrambles inside.=


"I gotta be crazy, I gotta be outa my processor.. Why of all places would=
 I be drawn to a dump like this?"

The rat thought quietly to himself. Then=
 it hits him. It wasn't energon but he had hoped he'd find that too.

"Wait=
 an astro sec... Energy signatures... Not Maximal, some preds, some cons, b=
ut there's somethn' else here.... Could - could it be? I gotta have a glitc=
h someplace,this can't be right." 

He continues to follow the energy signa=
ture. Of course he was honed in on Nightlights' and not Tucson, who was now=
 off line once again. It compells him although terrified of his surrounding=
s, Rat Trap presses on.

He could sense that trying to make his pressense k=
nown around Nightlight may be dangerous. He stops to think.

" Hmm, if I go=
 directly for that signature I'm a trapped rat. I better not go that way ri=
ght now... But I can feel it, definitely an Autobot signature." 

He finds =
himself directly beneath the area where Tucson was being dragged off. It co=
nfirms his findings.

" I was right. Okay, I can do this, just follow those=
 uglies under ground and hope they don't see me. I gotta get wheels back on=
line somehow. This ain't right, no way I'm gonna watch preds and cons take =
advantage of a good bunch of bots. I gotta be outa my processor..."

He had=
 heard Zarak speak of his battle station and puts two and two together. He =
waits for a moment, and as Tucson is dragged over the vent shaft, he scramb=
les quickly and hides within Tucson's helmet, still in his tiny beast form =
and balls up inside hoping not to be caught. Thoughts racing through his mi=
nd..

"This is crazy, this is completely insane, I can't believe I'm do'n t=
hiiiis. But I can't let those uglies win, I just can't. Don't worry wheels,=
 I'll get ya outa this bind, somehow..."

Even though Tucson is off line, R=
at Trap could sense something about the Autobot that was a bit different th=
an the others. He looks at him, and his physical form.

"You sure look fami=
lliar... Wait a sec... O - Optimus Prime... Holy servo scrap, no wonder why=
 I had this strong urge ta risk my tail end by commn' in here.. Ohh boy, I =
am sooo over my head." 

He backs further into Tucson's helmet and tries to=
 remain unseen. 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, <airly2002@...> wrote:
>
>=
 DarkHawk/Perceptor
> 
> "Hydras should be informed about the current situa=
tion in Maximal Base"replied the male while he was dragging Tucson " and th=
e female shouldl be moved to another place"
> 
> Perceptor replied "She won=
t move to any place and whoever tries to free her for her cell, would be th=
e indirect cause of her death... But you are right, We have to move her to =
another secure place"
> 
> 
> From: Super Cyclonus 
> Sent: Sunday, Februar=
y 21, 2010 6:45 AM
> To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> Subject: Re: Recovering =
Rodimus/BlackFortress
> 
> 
> 
> Cyclonus, Scourge and Rodimus watched as t=
he Autobot who was so thoroughly
> beaten by Hydras and left in a near func=
tionless state suddenly
> sprung to life! With a tenacity that surprised th=
em, the Autobot filled with the room with smoke, using only his tires, the =
power of his engines and the ambient dust on the floor. 
> 
> "He don't kno=
w when to quit!" Rodimus said as he watched the ruckus, trying to target th=
e Autobot through the smoke. 
> 
> "He is an Autobot." said Cyclonus as he =
turned to fire on the fleeing Tuscon
> 
> "Scrap!" Scourge fretted as the s=
moke interfeared with his sensors. 
> 
> It took a moment for thier optics =
and sensors to adjust, and by then the Autobot was already on the move. Eve=
n as Tuscon ran down on fuel the trio was in pursuit. 
> 
> >>"N - Night - =
Nightlight.. . Here...." 
> >>
> >>Tuscon's engine shuts 
> >>down. Clearly=
 there was not enough energy to make his escape, and he had not the 
> >>he=
art to leave a comrade behind. No matter if it were a Maximal or an Autobot=
. 
> >>His headlights dim, as his body now goes off line due to energy 
> >=
>exhaustion.
> 
> As Tuscon ran out of power and came to a stop, a door sli=
d open. "Yes Autobot, she is here, as are others." said a voice from the sh=
adowed interior of the room, "and now so are you."
> 
> >Darkhawk took one =
of his Feather 
> >missiles and ran towards Tucson and he Used a stunned gu=
n againts Him, then 
> >manually starting to transformn Him to his Robot mo=
de and once he was in 
> >his robot mode he tied him thignly. 
> 
> As Dark=
hawk finished his work, a figure moved from the room, the ambient light fin=
ally piercing the shadows as it stepped into the hall to reveal the form of=
 the head master unit called Zarak.
> 
> He casually stepped forward and le=
aned over the depowered and now stunned form of Tuscon, "We have use for on=
e like you." He ran a scanner over Tuscon's frame "Yes, one so like the old=
 Prime."
> 
> "You see it don't you Autobot?" Zarak said, speaking to the i=
nert form of Tuscon. "Our scanners also revealed something else." Zarak str=
aightened as he changed the feed of his scanner to link with the base scann=
ers, "There is a minion floating over the old Maximal base, quite possibly =
attacking it."
> 
> Zarak chuckled, "With it there, all your Autobot and Ma=
ximal friends are no doubt rushing to get there to defend that pitiful piec=
e of technology, possibly even some of the ones defending the ark." Zarak's=
 optics widened in mock surprise, "I'm surprised you didn't get the call."
=
> 
> Zarak smiled again, mockingly, derisively, "And now we have you, so mu=
ch like the old Prime and we have a lightly defended Ark and a Matrix waiti=
ng for us to plunder."
> 
> "MWHAHAHAHAaaa!"
> 
> "Yes, we have a use for h=
im." Zarak said as he turned to look at Darkhawk, "Bring him to my battle s=
tation, we have a treasure that awaits us!"
> 
> OOC: I am assuming that Tu=
scon is indeed knocked out. Please keep in mind Zarak is scanning Tuscon qu=
ite carefully, so playing possum will be difficult. 
> 
> Preston
> (Cyclon=
us/Scourge/Rodimus/Zarak)
>
